name: the runnymede-on-thames

reviews.text: we stayed at the Runnymede for a family wedding, where my two daughters were bridesmaids. As with previous reviews, the outside of the main building is a little disappointing. Once inside however, the hotel is beautiful and it's position on the lock at Runnymede is outstanding.
reviews.title: lovely stay

reviews.text: The rooms were huge (150/152/154), with river views. extremely comfortable furnishings and beds, and a huge flat screen TV.
reviews.title: Posh country hotel

reviews.text: The luxurious bathroom had all necessary facilities and toiletries, and an extremely powerful shower.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time

likes.disliked: — Expensive prices in the Angler's Bar and Conservatory

reviews.text: My husband and I had excellent breakfasts in the restaurant each morning, while my daughters had room service which they said was also good.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed the use of the spa facilities, particularly having a swim accompanied by the Leeds rugby team who were also resident this particular weekend!
reviews.title: Nice relaxing break

likes.disliked: — Dated A/C controls and small TV

reviews.text: Oh dear. English hotel. In other words, overrated and expensive.
reviews.title: Bring earplugs.

reviews.text: To be fair, the weather was rotten. This however did show up the poor workmanship; the car park's tarmac is uneven, and large puddles form. This is a real nuisance (and this is a 4-star hotel?). And since December in England is dark, I could not step outside to admire the river.
reviews.title: Very nice rooms and really helpful staff

reviews.text: The worst aspect was the A/C. Even when switched off, there was a constant hum. The first night I slept badly. The next two nights I had to use earplugs.
reviews.title: We got married here!

reviews.text: On the plus side, the swimming pool is big and nice. The gym is OK for a hotel gym.
reviews.title: I stay here every week, says it all...

likes.liked: — Great rooms, especially the River side, convenient for M25 and London trains, great food
likes.disliked: — M25 can be noisy, restaurants can get busy

reviews.text: Service? On two of the days, the newspaper I'd ordered was never delivered (but it was charged to me, of course).
reviews.title: very relaxing

likes.disliked: — THE ROOM COULD HAVE BEEN MORE LUXURIOUS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Runnymede on a Saturday night to celebrate my birthday. The exterior of the hotel is the biggest drawback, but i was prepared for this after reading other reviews. Inside is a vast improvement!
reviews.title: Overall pleasant stay, beware the school holidays!

likes.disliked: — value for money, tiny room, nosiy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are excellent (although a few struggle with English!), and we were allowed to check-in a few hours early.
reviews.title: First night of our honeymoon unfortunately interupted by kitchen fire!!!

reviews.text: The rooms are TINY (it reminded us of a cabin on a ship!), very compact, and we had a view of the M25. They are, however, clean, and have all the amenities you would expect (including a mini-bar kit-kat for £1.50!).
reviews.title: Wonderfullu Relaxing

likes.liked: — The Spa - my reflexology treatment in particular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a massage each in the spa, which was wonderful. Excellent facilities, and very pleasant staff. The pool is nice, although there is only a steam room, sauna and jacuzzi in the main area (plunge pools in changing rooms).
reviews.title: Excellent facilities

likes.liked: — Proximity to Windsor and spa facilities

reviews.text: We had dinner in the Leftbank restaurant, which was very good, although we paid a lot because we didnt have dessert and coffee (£28 for 2 courses, £29.95 for the full). Service was outstanding. Lunch in the Charlie Bells restaurant was ok, although it was packed and some others waited a long time to be served. Food is expensive for what it is.
reviews.title: Fantastic child friendly hotel

likes.liked: — child friendly and standard of accomodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night on a spa package deal. We got dinner, bed and breakfast plus three beauty treatments all included. We stayed in a delux riverside room.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.disliked: — The look of the exterior (looked like an office block)

reviews.text: The room was clean and the bed was the biggest, softest I have ever seen! The beauty treatments I had were expertly carried out and the beauty therapist was very friendly and professional. Charlie's Bells served us a delicious lunch and dinner in Leftbank was lovely. We'd requested a window table and had the best table in the restaurant. The staff were very friendly and polite and had no problem with my special requests concerning food. The reception staff were lovely too and offered us assistance with our luggage.
reviews.title: Would reccomend

reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights, partly to visit Legoland.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: The setting next to the river is lovely, and there is a real spacious feel to the hotel, at the front too. I didn't have a river view, as my room was overlooking the front, but I could still see for miles into the country which was nice.
reviews.title: loved charie bells especilly Richard he was just lovely

likes.disliked: — caters more for the business clientelle

reviews.text: The reception staff were very welcoming on arrival, offering games to borrow for our children (11 and 9). Most of the staff are very pleasant and you get the impression they are happy to work there, which makes a nice change.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, well worth a visit

description: Set right on the banks of the river Thames we are the perfect location for a short break. Our family friendly hotel is near attractions, theme parks and fantastic sights. There's so much to do right here too with riverside walks, our award-winning spa, gorgeous riverside dining and much more.
